attributes.additional_details:
Tranmere Rovers should be allowed to develop Ingleborough field without being met with vexatious and malicious attacks in the local press.
Tranmere Rovers is a cultural and community icon, and attracts tens of thousands of visitors each year.
Tranmere fans are Wirral residents and council tax payers and our voice should be heard.
The plan’s for the development of Ingleborough fields has met opposition, due to the war memorial and trees planted in memory of lives from Birkenhead institute lost during the war. The plans rightly include re-sighting of the plaque and the trees to be maintained.
